Description: Rim sherd of Chian pottery Type B1 kantharos; white slip; interior: reserved band around rim and glazed streaky black below; lotus flower in added white outline with added red centre followed by two concentric white bands; exterior: narrow black line on edge of rim and reserved below; dipinto inscription on exterior.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Sanctuary of Aphrodite (Naukratis) (according to Ashmolean Museum register)
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by University College Dublin, Department of Classics, Classical Museum. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Kantharoi Type B1 have lotus flowers and lotus buds on the interior above two concentric white bands (Williams 1983, 169). Many kantharoi Type B have painted inscriptions beneath the rim and several have been found on Aegina as well as at Naukratis. Williams, D. ‘Aigina, Aphaia-Tempel 5. The pottery from Chios’, Archäologischer Anzeiger 1983
The alternative Ashmolean number of the piece was V186a, not V186c, as recorded by Vickers
Bibliographic references: Vickers 1971 / Some Unpublished Sherds from Naukratis in Dublin (p. 115, no. 4, pl. 13.D)
CVA UCD & UCC / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Ireland, Fascicule 1: University College Dublin, University College Cork (p. 14, no. 5-6, pl. 11, no. 5-6)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1867) (phase 2)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: AN1888.218 (Old Ashmolean Museum accession number)
Miscellaneous number: V.186.a (Old Ashmolean Museum vase number)
